page.title: 03WILD LIFE AND ECOLOGY II
page.content: The most{common birds}to be found in this area are Magpies, Pigeons, Sparrows and Flycatchers, whilst close to habitation come House Martins, Finches, Blackbirds,Thrushes and Robins. {The woodland area}provides a habitat for Rabbits, Foxes, Deer, Grey Squirrels and some Badger.Pheasant abound in the woods near Spye Park (next block south) reared for the local shoot. There is a{network of footpaths across the whole of the area which exist as{rights of way,}most of which are walkable but some have been wired up by local farmers. The Lacock Parish Council maintain records of their paths but a survey has not been carried out since 1972.
